lexUnit.name: thunder.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak loudly, angrily, and forcefully, especially to protest:

sentence.text: ` Stop telling me reasons why it ca n't be done , " the Prince thundered , ` and get on and find a way . "
` Place the brat on the fire , " he thundered .
` Donna Frizzell , I thought better of you ! " she thundered .
` Roger Shallot , " the magistrate thundered , ` we find you guilty of these terrible murders and so you must pay the full penalty of the law .
` I have treated you with respect , " he thundered .
` Lord Altrincham is a bounder , " thundered the Earl of Strathmore , ` he should be shot . "
` Sick , my eye , " thundered Miss Lodsworth , ` That horse is n't sick , it 's dead drunk .
` Sit down ! " thundered Morse with immense authority ; and simply , silently Downes did as he was bidden .
He thundered the command at her .
` Traitors out of the Kremlin , " thundered the Communist Party leader , Gennady Zyuganov .
` No " thundered the vast majority of every poll conducted by newspapers , radio and television , members and public alike .
I am resisting the temptation to thunder about AIDS being a judgment upon them , etc .
History was taught by a whiskery professor who thundered about the Origin and Destiny of Imperial Britain .
He was thundering at the hecklers .
Father Peter thundered at the multitude , ` Shall ye speak of sin and not know the wrath of God ? "
` I 'm alone , " he thundered at the television screen .
And keep still , " he thundered as Hilary wriggled futilely .
